intro: Chomelia gracilipes, commonly known as the slender chomelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Chomelia gracilipes is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
